CDFglobalAttributes.Project: STSP Cluster>Solar Terrestrial Science Programmes, Cluster
CDFglobalAttributes.TEXT:
The EFW (Electric Field and Wave) instrument consists of four spherical
probes deployed orthogonally on 44-meter-long wire booms in the spin
plane of the spacecraft. The potential differences between opposing
probes, separated by 88 m tip-to-tip, are measured to provide electric
field measurements in two directions, thus providing the full electric
field vector in the spin plane of the spacecraft. Additionally, the
potential differences between each of the probes and the spacecraft are
measured, providing an estimate of the spacecraft potential relative
to the plasma, which can be used as a proxy for the ambient electron
density. The output analogue signals from the preamplifiers connected
to the spherical probes are also provided to the wave instruments
(STAFF, WHISPER and WBD) for analysis of high frequency wave phenomena.
CDFglobalAttributes.MISSION_DESCRIPTION:
The aim of the Cluster mission is to study small-scale structures of the magnetosphere 
and its environment in three dimensions. To achieve this, Cluster is constituted of four 
identical spacecraft that will flight in a tetrahedral configuration. The separation distances 
between the spacecraft will be varied between ~3 km and 67 000 km, according to the 
key scientific regions.
CDFglobalAttributes.MISSION_REFERENCES: The Cluster and Phoenix Missions>Cluster project and instrument teams>Space Sci. Rev. 79, Nos. 1-2, 1997

*C3_CQ
Main planned commissioning events : 
 - 2000-07-16T12:39Z/2000-07-16T12:39Z :  Launch 1
 - 2000-07-16T12:39Z/2000-10-18T19:15Z :  SC not at 15 rpm
 - 2000-07-24T00:00Z/2000-07-24T04:00Z :  ASPOC+CIS cover opening
 - 2000-08-22T12:09Z/2000-08-22T17:39Z :  FGM Switch-on + tests
 - 2000-09-05T19:39Z/2000-09-05T20:19Z :  WEC Spin up satellite to 22 rpm + sphere release (B.5)
 - 2000-10-09T10:35Z/2000-10-09T11:35Z :  WEC First full WEC on (A.4)
 - 2000-10-11T17:15Z/2000-10-11T18:15Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4 and  to 15 m (B.3)
 - 2000-10-11T18:15Z/2000-10-11T19:15Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2 from 1.3 m to 15 m (B.4)
 - 2000-10-11T19:15Z/2000-10-11T19:55Z :  WEC Spin up satellite to 22 rpm + sphere release (B.5)
 - 2000-10-16T16:18Z/2000-10-16T17:18Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4  from 15 m to 35 m (C.2)
 - 2000-10-16T17:18Z/2000-10-16T17:48Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2  from 15 m to 20 m (C.3)
 - 2000-10-18T15:20Z/2000-10-18T15:55Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4 from 35 m to 43 m (D.2)
 - 2000-11-08T14:51Z/2000-11-08T16:01Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2 from 20 m to 43 m (E.2)
 - 2000-12-06T11:00Z/2000-12-20T18:30Z :  Interferences + Intercalibration (6 orbits)/ JSOC OBRQ

CDFglobalAttributes.EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION:
The EFW (Electric Field and Wave) instrument consists of four spherical
probes deployed orthogonally on 44-meter-long wire booms in the spin
plane of the spacecraft. The potential differences between opposing
probes, separated by 88 m tip-to-tip, are measured to provide electric
field measurements in two directions, thus providing the full electric
field vector in the spin plane of the spacecraft. Additionally, the
potential differences between each of the probes and the spacecraft are
measured, providing an estimate of the spacecraft potential relative
to the plasma, which can be used as a proxy for the ambient electron
density. The output analogue signals from the preamplifiers connected
to the spherical probes are also provided to the wave instruments
(STAFF, WHISPER and WBD) for analysis of high frequency wave phenomena.

CDFglobalAttributes.EXPERIMENT_CAVEATS:
Caveats for the Cluster EFW experiment:
For general information on EFW, please visit the EFW home page
http://www.cluster.irfu.se
For general information on EFW operations, both standard operations and
anomalies, please visit the EFW operations home page
http://www.cluster.irfu.se/efw/ops
For a chronological table of all non-standard operations and known
instrument anomalies, please visit the EFW non-standard operations home
page
http://www.cluster.irfu.se/efw/ops/ns_ops.html
For more information on data quality and how the CAA data are processed
please consult the EFW CAA Users Guide and the EFW CAA Interface Control
Document (ICD).
CDFglobalAttributes.INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION: Electric Field and Wave (EFW) Experiment on Cluster C3
CDFglobalAttributes.INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS:
Events:
2002-07-29 09:07 Probe 1 failed
2011-03-05 18:13 -- 2011-06-01 Wec OFF
2011-06-01 09:31 Probe 3 failed
2014-11-03 20:58 Probe 2 failed
Implications:
Before 2002-07-29 C3 EFW uses all probes, and full time resolution
vector electric field data are available using 4 probes in the spin
plane.
After 2002-07-29 C3 EFW uses only 3 probes, and full time resolution
vector electric field data are available using only 3 probes in the spin
plane. The effect is reduced quality in the full time resolution
electric field data (25 samples/s in NM, 450 samples/s in BM).
Spacecraft potential data and 4-second resolution electric field data
are not affected.
After 2011-06-01 no full resolution data available.
All products have reduced quality.
EFW operations caveats:
*C3_CQ_EFW_INST
CDFglobalAttributes.DATASET_DESCRIPTION:
This dataset contains measurements of the
negative of the Spacecraft potential (4 sec resolution)
from the EFW experiment on the Cluster C3 spacecraft
CDFglobalAttributes.Acknowledgement:
Please acknowledge the EFW team and the ESA Cluster Active Archive in any
publication based upon use of these data
